Friendly service and personal attention by the chef and staff set the stage for a wonderful meal in this charming bistro.

lic_profile: Most appropriately named, music lovers and food enthusiasts have made Alleycatz a popular dining and party destination. A menu with Mediterranean flair, a varied martini line-up and after dinner entertainment in the form of salsa, bachata, and live bands playing blues & top 40's dance music. Warm and convivial in red oak and exposed brick, Alleycatz sets a comfortable and fun environment for their guests.

lic_profile: Amano Pasta, a new underground restaurant at Toronto’s Union Station is an open concept, handmade pasta bar inspired by Italian heritage, but not defined by it. Chef Michael Angeloni combines classic Italian cooking techniques taught to him by his nonna, with locally sourced, often unexpected ingredients. While the dishes are Italian, many of the ingredients (like black sesame, jalapeño, and tahini) are not. Amano offers classic Italian eats like Fat Tubes Rigatoni Bolognese with local Ontario beef and pork, with the focal point of the menu being a section Chef Angeloni has dubbed ‘Not Your Nonna’sPasta’. Amano’s wine list includes Italian classics but is rounded off with Canadian offerings, which either focus on Italian wine making techniques or grapes themselves.

lic_profile: Aria offers genuine Italian fine dining in a contemporary urban setting. Aria is owned by Guido Saldini and Elena Morelli the proprietors of Noce Restaurant which has helped set the standard for Italian cuisine in Toronto for almost 20 years.  "Aria" means "air" in Italian but also references the most Italian of art forms - opera.  Both themes are evident inside Aria which boasts a dramatic 35 foot ceiling and is situated adjacent to the Air Canada Centre and Maple Leaf Square. Aria has dining capacity for 130 people and can accommodate private parties in a variety of formats.

lic_profile: Housed in a historical building, Bangkok Garden is one of the first restaurants to introduce traditional Thai cuisine and culture to Toronto over 30 years ago, and is acclaimed as one of North America's premier Thai restaurants. One of only four Toronto restaurants to be awarded the Thai Select Premium designation from the Thai government, recognizing authenticity of food and outstanding service, Bangkok Garden serves food based on the Thai principle of balancing the five tastes: sweet, hot, sour, salty and bitter, including fiery stir fry and flavourful curries. The bar offers a large selection of exotic cocktails, international beers and an extensive wine list.

lic_profile: Beaumont Kitchen is a comfortable all-day dining lounge located inside Saks Fifth Avenue at CF Sherway Gardens. Amidst its sleek design, rich textures and whimsical accents, the space features plush loungers and banquettes, formal dining tables and relaxed bar seating, making it ideal for long lunches, midday snacking, casual dinners and special occasions. Owning a deep understanding of and respect for food, Beaumont Kitchen’s chefs source interesting, quality ingredients from nearby purveyors, and trust in the ingredients’ natural flavours and beauty to shine with minimal preparation.

lic_profile: A Japanese steakhouse experience in the heart of Toronto, Benihana lets you enjoy the excitement of teppan cooking right at your table.  Instead of using conventional kitchens, Benihana's highly skilled chefs present and prepare the freshest beef, seafood and produce at a 'hibachi' table (a flat 4'x 3' grill), around which, up to eight guests are seated. A fast-paced performance of chopping and juggling creates an exciting teppanyaki-style dining experience for guests of all ages.

lic_profile: An elegant French Bistro, Caren's Rosedale boasts a relaxed formal atmosphere that is as sophisticated as it is welcoming. Chef David Nang Nang delivers authentic French classics and daily specials with a Parisian flare, blending new menu items and favourites from Caren's Wine and Cheese Bar in Yorkville. The chic, contemporary setting is perfect for a romantic evening, dinner with family or a night of cocktails with friends at the bar. lic_profile: Cibo Wine Bar is the biggest and newest Italian restaurant in the Uptown Yonge Street area. Created by Liberty Entertainment Group, this bold and beautiful 10,000 sq ft space is a blend of old world rustic and modern industrial chic.

A true taste of authentic southern Italian cooking freshly made amongst patrons at the 40ft open kitchen counter.  2500 bottles of vino in a soaring two-story award winning wine room equipped with harnessed wine angel to retrieve your favorite bottle.

From Cibo's industrial chic vibrant bar area to the casual Yonge Street patio, every corner turned offers a distinctly different experience.  This celebrated restaurant would not be complete without original artwork from renowned artist Mr. Brainwash.  When on Yonge Street, this space cannot be missed!

lic_profile: Diwan's elegant interior evokes the luxury of a private Syrian home in the early 19th century.  Sumptuously decorated with wooden panels inset with mirrors, the room extends the Museum experience to diners: the panels are original and form part of the Aga Khan Museum's Permanent Collection.  Diwan's floor-to-ceiling windows offer a stunning view of the formal garden of the Aga Khan Park designed by Lebanon-based landscape architect Vladimir Djurovic, who visited the world's historic Islamic gardens for inspiration.

Master Chef Mark McEwan and Chef de Cuisine John Kovac offer a menu that highlights flavours and fragrances from the Middle East, North Africa and the Indian subcontinent. Prepared with local and international ingredients, the menu celebrates the many textures and flavours of traditional cuisine with unexpected twists on spicy and savoury dishes.

Sparkling chandeliers, large, gilded mirrors, and intimate tables have been part of why Kalendar has been continually voted as the best place for a first date and the  most romantic restaurant in Toronto. Kalendar offers a wide variety of cravable dishes and eclectic, international comfort food.

lic_profile: Praised as one of the "Ten Chefs of the Millennium" in 2000 by food & Wine magazine, Susur Lee is still at the top of his game.  Between helming three restaurants in Toronto - Lee, Bent & Luckee - and overseeing his prestigious TungLok Heen in Singapore, Chef Lee makes numerous television appearances and travels the globe as guest chef and consultant.  Balancing the epicurean traditions of China with the classical techniques of French cuisines, Chef Lee improvises a daring and original culinary aesthetic. Frequently appearing many of Toronto publication's "Best of" lists, Lee offers a menu inspired by the convergence of land and sea with seasonality in mind.  From the bar comes a sake driven wine list and fresh-to-order cocktails with handmade ingredients.

lic_profile: A Chef Anthony Walsh creation, Leña pays homage to his Argentinian mother-in-law, Elena, from whom he has drawn great culinary inspiration, and embodies what he experiences in her kitchen – a passionate food philosophy that brings people together. Imaginative yet rooted in tradition, Leña’s cuisine showcases the vibrant essence of South American cooking, with unique Spanish and Italian influences. It, along with the stylish design, warm character and lively tunes, promotes a “live to eat” ethos and fosters a convivial spirit at the table. Above all, Leña celebrates authentic, flavourful food and drink, enjoyed amongst old and new friends.

lic_profile: Parts & Labour offers a casual fine dining experience in a minimalist industrial design space. Located in the heart of Parkdale, this restaurant is outfitted with large communal tables and reclaimed lighting fixtures made of re-purposed fire extinguishers. Head Chef Benjamin Daiken's menu is a well balanced mix of international inspiration and contemporary takes on classic dishes. Boasting an impressive cocktail program, along with a wide variety of beer, spirits and wine, there is surely something to suit any palate. The organic rooftop garden and apiary contribute many ingredients to both the food and cocktail program, helping achieve the restaurant's goals in providing locally sourced sustainability. This energetic space is perfect for large groups and couples alike, whether it be a special occasion or a casual meal mid-week.

lic_profile: Peoples Eatery is a unique dining establishment that aims to celebrate the city’s cultural diversity with a menu that’s all over the map - but without fusion cuisine. Dishes are true to their respective origins and live happily together on a single menu, representing the city’s motto: ‘Diversity our Strength’. Chef/Partner Dustin Gallagher, recently of Top Chef Canada All-Stars, helms the kitchen with a menu driven by ‘crunch-to-squish ratio’, fun-to-eat, punchy-flavoured, technique-driven dishes. The bar program by managing partner, Matt See, includes carefully chosen beer, wine and cocktail lists which round out Peoples Eatery’s offerings. Dining at the bar or in a number of private spaces for larger groups makes Peoples a distinctively unique restaurant in an unexpected location: look for candle light in the front windows.

lic_profile: For over 30 years, Ristorante Boccaccio has shown a passion for Italian culture, reflected in the wine, food, service and décor, steeped in tradition to create an environment of warmth and familiarity. Whether it's an intimate dining experience for two or a family gathering to celebrate life's milestones, the staff at Ristorante Boccaccio take pleasure in ensuring that your experience extends beyond dining.

lic_profile: Husband and wife team, Chef Rony Goraichy and Diana Sideris, are the heart of Tabülè. Located in the heart of midtown Toronto, Tabülè offers a cozy ambience with refined yet comforting takes on the exotic flavours of the Middle East. Using the freshest quality ingredients, Goraichy's interpretation of traditional dishes has resulted in a menu bursting with robust flavour to delight the senses. Tabülè also offers vegan and gluten free menu options, and desserts made in house.  The drink menu includes a variety of wine, exotic martinis, fresh juices and loose leaf teas.

lic_profile: The Fifth’s boutique restaurant offers a rooftop patio, romantic ambience and delicious cooking. The Dining Room is an intimate space with fire-side sofas and eclectic décor while the Terrace is a rooftop oasis with spectacular views of downtown Toronto. Headed by Executive French Chef JP Challet and Chef Robert Toppan, the accomplished culinary team creates a modern cuisine to reflect today’s tastes and respect vegetarian and gluten-free diets. This summer, enjoy alfresco dining with Mediterranean inspired foods, wines and fresh flavours from the French Riviera to the Amalfi Coast.

lic_profile: Via Mercanti is a small family operated pizzeria and restaurant.  The "hidden" Elm Street location features a beautiful 60-seat outdoor patio and large dining rooms in the historic part of the YWCA building.  Highly passionate about good food and quality ingredients, Via Mercanti has been ranked on Joanne Kates' top 100 list, won Best in Chow's hit show "Pizza Wars" and been featured on "You Gotta Eat Here!"

lic_profile: A modern saloon, Weslodge delivers an elegant but hearty menu, artfully authentic cocktails and a sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere featuring cutting edge décor. Executive Chef Ben Heaton has developed a variety of innovative yet approachable dishes, executed with a high level of technique. Weslodge's libations are created by a team of pure spirit mixologists led by Elan Marks. House made ingredients elevate classic cocktails to retain their original integrity.
